snippet: The city comptroller, Scott M. Stringer, unveiled a letter-grading system to track agency spending on goods and services provided by businesses that women and minorities own.
abstract: Comptroller Scott M Stringer unveils letter-grading system that rates New York City agencies in terms of their spending on goods and services provided by businesses owned by women and minorities; inaugural report gives city overall grade of D, reflecting fact that only 3.9 percent of city's procurement budget went to such businesses.
lead_paragraph: The city comptroller, Scott M. Stringer, unveiled a letter-grading system to track agency spending on goods and services provided by businesses that women and minorities own.

headline.main: Stringer Faults New York City on Diversity of Its Vendors
headline.print_headline: Comptroller Faulting City on Diversity of Its Vendors
